channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The S&P is soaring, but fewer companies are setting record highs. Why that could be a red flag for the market
item.description: Pay attention to market breadth, analysts say.

item.title: The Gen Z glossary for Gen X managers: Here’s what your workers mean by ‘menty B’ and ‘cozzie livs’
item.description: It won’t be long until Gen X managers feel left out of watercooler chats with their twentysomething-year-old workers.

item.title: It’s a cruel summer for student loan borrowers. Here’s how business leaders can make the case for better benefits for their employees
item.description: As the Trump administration allows garnishing wages of borrowers in default, experts say student loan benefits are a business imperative.

item.title: Why a Goofy Mascot Could Be Your Marketing Team’s Secret Weapon
item.description: Silly but lovable characters aren’t just for sports teams and fast food chains anymore.

item.title: How to Use Empathy to Respond to the Amazon Prime Machine
item.description: Learn what the world’s biggest deals engine can teach you about building community.

item.title: Linda Yaccarino brought some advertisers back to X—but the real power was always with owner Elon Musk
item.description: The former NBCUniversal exec is leaving after two years, following Musk's sale of X to his own company xAI.

item.title: ‘I’ve been clean for a week!’: Reddit is now home to support groups for people addicted to AI chatbots
item.description: In recent years, people have welcomed AI into their lives with open arms: as personal assistants, friends, therapists, even lovers. But one concern wi...

item.title: Steve Jobs Said Perseverance Separates the Doers From the Dreamers, But Science Says This Trait Actually Predicts Success
item.description: Staying the course matters, but research shows what you do while staying the course is crucial to success.

item.title: CEOs reacting to tariffs with wait-and-see have a dangerous misread of the moment
item.description: Tariffs aren’t the cause of disruption. They’re the accelerant—and companies risk falling behind.

item.title: The Stock Market and Bond Market Disagree on the Economic Outlook
item.description: The stock market reflects optimism while the bond market sees a slowdown.

item.title: Try These 5 Tips to Get Your Message Across and Lead With Clarity
item.description: When making points in a presentation or a meeting, the right word is often the simplest and most direct.
